entry.title: Getting Started with Sublime Text 2
entry.content:
<p>Although I switched to <a href="http://www.sublimetext.com/">Sublime Text 2</a> more than a year ago, I only recently decided to take a good look at my configuration, with the end goal of increasing my productivity. What follows are my settings, which will hopefully help others work a bit smarter. If you’ve got any useful tips, please <a href="https://twitter.com/davidensinger">tweet</a> at me!</p>

<h2>Pasting</h2>

<p>Some projects use tabs, while others use spaces. It’s nice to easily copy and paste snippets of code between the two, without worrying about the indentation.</p>

<p>To adjust your indentation to match the context in which it’s pasted, use “Paste and Indent” for <strong>⌘V</strong> instead of the standard “Paste.”</p>

<p>To do this, add the following in your <strong>Key Bindings – User file</strong>:</p>

<div class="highlight"><pre><code class="json"><span class="p">{</span> <span class="nt">"keys"</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"super+v"</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="nt">"command"</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s2">"paste_and_indent"</span> <span class="p">}</span><span class="err">,</span> <span class="p">{</span> <span class="nt">"keys"</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"super+shift+v"</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="nt">"command"</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s2">"paste"</span> <span class="p">}</span> </code></pre></div>

<h2>Shortcuts</h2>

<p>There are a lot of really useful keyboard shortcuts in Sublime Text 2. Instead of listing them all, I’m going to list some favorites. With a quick search of the internet you’ll surely find more to integrate into your workflow.</p>

<ul> <li><strong>⌘L</strong> – Select line</li> <li><strong>⌘D</strong> – Select word (use this to select other occurrences, which is great for multiple editing)</li> <li><strong>⌘P</strong> – Goto anything (use <strong>#</strong> to search within file and <strong>:</strong> to go to a line number)</li> <li><strong>⌘⌃G</strong> – Select all occurrences of current word (again, helpful for multiple editing)</li> <li><strong>⌃⌘↑ (up) or ↓(down)</strong> – Swap lines either up or down</li> </ul>

<div class="yellow-box"> <p><strong>More Info:</strong> Here’s a <a href="https://gist.github.com/lucasfais/1207002">Gist of Useful Shortcuts</a> by <a href="https://twitter.com/lucasfais">@lucasfais</a>.</p> </div>

<h2>Package Control</h2>

<p>One of the best things about Sublime Text 2 is how extensible it is. There are hundreds of community developed plugins and with <a href="http://wbond.net/sublime_packages/package_control">Package Control</a> it’s quick and easy to install, update, and remove them from your installation.</p>

<h3>Installation</h3>

<ol> <li>Open Sublime Text 2 and press <strong>ctrl `</strong> (control backtick) to open the editor’s console.</li> <li>Paste in the following code:</li> </ol>

<div class="highlight"><pre><code class="python"><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">urllib2</span><span class="o">,</span><span class="nn">os</span><span class="p">;</span> <span class="n">pf</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">'Package Control.sublime-package'</span><span class="p">;</span> <span class="n">ipp</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">sublime</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">installed_packages_path</span><span class="p">();</span> <span class="n">os</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">makedirs</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ipp</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="k">if</span> <span class="ow">not</span> <span class="n">os</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">path</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">exists</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ipp</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="k">else</span> <span class="bp">None</span><span class="p">;</span> <span class="n">urllib2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">install_opener</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">urllib2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">build_opener</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">urllib2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ProxyHandler</span><span class="p">()));</span> <span class="nb">open</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">os</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">path</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">join</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ipp</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">pf</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="s">'wb'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">write</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">urllib2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">urlopen</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">'http://sublime.wbond.net/'</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">pf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">' '</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s">'%20'</span><span class="p">))</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read</span><span class="p">());</span> <span class="k">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">'Please restart Sublime Text to finish installation'</span><span class="p">)</span> </code></pre></div>

<h3>Favorite Packages</h3>

<ul> <li><a href="https://github.com/alienhard/SublimeAllAutocomplete">All Autocomplete</a> – Allows autocompletion across open files</li> <li><a href="http://gcollazo.github.io/BrowserRefresh-Sublime/">Browser Refresh</a> – Refresh your browser from within the editor</li> <li><a href="https://github.com/sindresorhus/editorconfig-sublime">EditorConfig</a> – <a href="http://editorconfig.org/">Editor Config</a> helps define and maintain consistent coding styles between different editors and IDEs</li> <li><a href="https://github.com/gornostal/Modific">Modific</a> -Highlight lines changed since the last commit</li> <li><a href="https://github.com/titoBouzout/SideBarEnhancements">SideBarEnhancements</a> – Adds useful file operations to the sidebar, such as “New file”, “New folder”, etc</li> <li><a href="https://github.com/SublimeLinter/SublimeLinter">SublimeLinter</a> – Lint code as you type</li> <li><a href="https://github.com/SublimeText/TrailingSpaces">TrailingSpaces</a> – Strips trailing whitespace from files</li> </ul>

<p>There are also innumerable packages to support syntax highlighting, linting, and snippets in any and all languages. You can easily <a href="http://wbond.net/sublime_packages/community">discover these via Package Control</a>.</p>

<h2>Spaces</h2>

<p>Open <strong>TrailingSpace’s</strong> preferences (<strong>Preferences › Package Settings › TrailingSpaces › Settings – User</strong>), and add:</p>

<div class="highlight"><pre><code class="json"><span class="s2">"trailing_spaces_include_current_line"</span><span class="err">:</span> <span class="kc">false</span> </code></pre></div>

<p>Also add this to your global user preferences (<strong>⌘,</strong>):</p>

<div class="highlight"><pre><code class="json"><span class="s2">"trim_trailing_white_space_on_save"</span><span class="err">:</span> <span class="kc">true</span> </code></pre></div>

<h2>Tabs to Spaces</h2>

<p>The default indentation style uses tabs instead of spaces. If you want to change this, go to your user preferences (<strong>Preferences › Settings – User</strong> or <strong>⌘,</strong>) and add:</p>

<div class="highlight"><pre><code class="json"><span class="s2">"tab_size"</span><span class="err">:</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="err">,</span> <span class="s2">"translate_tabs_to_spaces"</span><span class="err">:</span> <span class="kc">true</span> </code></pre></div>

<h2>Other Resources</h2>

<p>There are a multitude of resources available to users of Sublime Text 2. Here are some good ones to read through:</p>

<ul> <li><a href="http://www.sublimetext.com/docs/2/">Official Documentation</a></li> <li><a href="http://docs.sublimetext.info/en/latest/index.html">Unofficial Documentation</a></li> <li><a href="http://blog.alexmaccaw.com/sublime-text">Setting up Sublime Text 2</a></li> <li><a href="http://robdodson.me/blog/2012/06/23/sublime-text-2-tips-and-shortcuts/">Sublime Text 2 Tips and Shortcuts</a></li> <li><a href="http://whiletruecode.com/post/7-handy-text-manipulation-tricks-sublime-text-2">7 handy text manipulation tricks in Sublime Text 2</a></li> </ul>
